-
-
Ours Noir
-
Mossi society was divided into two classes, the Nakombse and Tengbiise. Nakombse were the political elite and noblemen who claimed to be direct descendents of the original Mossi warriors who founded the Empire, whereas Tengbiise were the inhabitants of places annexed by the Mossi. Tengbiise were a craftsman and spiritual class, and though they could never access political authority, they were nonetheless respected for their services and entitlement to the land that they had inhabited since ancient times. Nakombse noblemen would organise campaigns to annex unclaimed lands to create new kingdoms, they were also incredibly fast and could delve deep into enemy territory.
-
The incredible speed of the Nakombse makes it valuable for recon and formidable when it comes to hit and run attacks, and if it is trapped between a rock and a hard place, they may retreat from melee attacks. The extra movement also makes snatching land from the slow moving settlers of other empires a breeze.
-
Knight replacement; 6 [ICON_MOVES] movement points instead of 4. May withdraw from melee attacks.
-

Nakombse were the political elite and noblemen who claimed to be direct descendents of the original Mossi warriors who founded the Empire, whereas Tengbiise were the inhabitants of places annexed by the Mossi. Tengbiise were a craftsman and spiritual class, and though they could never access political authority, they were nonetheless respected for their services and entitlement to the land that they had inhabited since ancient times. Nakombse noblemen would organise campaigns to annex unclaimed lands to create new kingdoms, they were also incredibly fast and could delve deep into enemy territory.

The incredible speed of the Nakombse makes it valuable for recon and formidable when it comes to hit and run attacks, and if it is trapped between a rock and a hard place, they may retreat from melee attacks. The extra movement also makes snatching land from the slow moving settlers of other empires a breeze.
